sen.j: 本項京都市左京区の町名（きょうとしさきょうくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section on the Town Names in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City lists the official town names in the ward and describes when and how they were established.

tit.e: Summary of Sakyo Ward
Summary of Sakyo Ward
Summary of Sakyo Ward

sen.j: 京都市街地の東北方、鴨川（賀茂川）の東岸に位置する。
sen.e: Sakyo Ward is located on the eastern bank of the Kamo-gawa River (spelt as 鴨川 or 賀茂川), northeast of the downtown of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sakyo Ward is located on the eastern bank of the Kamo-gawa River (spelt as 鴨川 or 賀茂川), northeast of the downtown of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北方の大原、鞍馬などの山間部を含んだ広大な面積を有する。
sen.e: It covers a vast area with the mountainous region in the north, including Ohara and Kurama.

sen.j: 区域は南北に長く、最北端は標高959メートルの三国岳山頂である。
sen.e: It is vertically elongated with the farthest north being at the top of Mt. Mikuni which is 959 meters high above sea level.
It is vertically elongated with the farthest north being at the top of Mt. Mikuni which is 959 meters high above sea level.

sen.j: 区の東は京都府と滋賀県の府県境をなし、滋賀県大津市及び高島市に接する。
sen.e: Its eastern part is the border between the prefectures of Kyoto and Shiga, bordering the Cities of Otsu and Takashima, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 府県境に位置する比叡山の西側は当区に属する。
sen.e: The western side of Mt. Hiei which is situated between the two prefectures belongs to the ward.
The western side of Mt. Hiei which is situated between the two prefectures belongs to the ward.

sen.j: 区の南は東山区及び山科区、北は京都府南丹市（美山地区）、西は右京区（京北地区）及び北区 (京都市)に接する。
sen.e: The ward borders Higashiyama Ward and Yamashina Ward in the south, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture (the Miyama area) in the north, Ukyo Ward (the Keihoku area) and Kita Ward (Kyoto City) in the west.

sen.j: 南端近くの一部が上京区及び中京区に接する。
sen.e: It is in part adjacent to the Wards of Kamigyo and Nakagyo near the south edge.

sen.j: 面積246.88平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It has an area of 246.88 square kilometers.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約166,000人。
sen.e: It had an estimated population of approximately 166,000 in March 2009.

sen.j: 区の南部には平安神宮、南禅寺、慈照寺（銀閣寺）、下鴨神社（賀茂御祖神社）、修学院離宮などの著名社寺や史跡がある。
sen.e: In the south it has the following famous temples, shrines and historical sites: Heian-jingu Shrine, Nanzen-ji Temple, Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple), Shimogamo-jinja Shrine (Kamomioya-jinja Shrine) and Shugakuin Palace.

In the south it has the following famous temples, shrines and historical sites: Heian-jingu Shrine, Nanzen-ji Temple, Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple), Shimogamo-jinja Shrine (Kamomioya-jinja Shrine) and Shugakuin Palace.

sen.j: 岡崎公園、京都会館、京都国立近代美術館、京都市動物園、京都大学吉田キャンパス、京都府立植物園、京都府立総合資料館、国立京都国際会館などの施設もある。
sen.e: It also has the following facilities: Okazaki-koen Park, Kyoto-kaikan Hall, The National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto, Kyoto City Zoo, Kyoto University Yoshida Campus, The Kyoto Botanical Garden, Kyoto Prefectural Library and Archives and Kyoto International Conference Center.

sen.j: 区の中部から北部は人口密度の低い山間部である。
sen.e: Its middle to the northern part is a mountainous region where population density is low.
Its middle to the northern part is a mountainous region where population density is low.

sen.j: 東には国道367号（鯖街道、若狭街道）が通り、比叡山の西の登り口である八瀬地区、三千院や寂光院のある大原地区を通って若狭方面へ通じている。
sen.e: In the east National Route 367 (Saba-kaido Road and Wakasa-kaido Road) runs, leading to the Wakasa area via the western entrance to Mt. Hiei in the Yase area as well as the Ohara area with Sanzen-in Temple and Jakko-in Temple.

In the east National Route 367 (Saba-kaido Road and Wakasa-kaido Road) runs, leading to the Wakasa area via the western entrance to Mt. Hiei in the Yase area as well as the Ohara area with Sanzen-in Temple and Jakko-in Temple.

In the east National Route 367 (Saba-kaido Road and Wakasa-kaido Road) runs, leading to the Wakasa area via the western entrance to Mt. Hiei in the Yase area as well as the Ohara area with Sanzen-in Temple and Jakko-in Temple.

sen.j: 西には京都府道38号京都広河原美山線（鞍馬街道）が通り、鞍馬寺のある鞍馬地区、花脊、広河原を通って南丹市方面へ通じている。
sen.e: In the west the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama-kaido Road) of Kyoto Prefectural Road 38 runs, leading to Nantan City through the Kurama area, where Kurama-dera Temple is, Hanase and Hirogawara.

In the west the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama-kaido Road) of Kyoto Prefectural Road 38 runs, leading to Nantan City through the Kurama area, where Kurama-dera Temple is located, as well as Hanase and Hirogawara.

sen.j: 区の最北端の久多地区はかつて京都府愛宕郡（おたぎぐん）に属したが、地理的には東の滋賀県方面とのつながりが強い。
sen.e: The Kuta area which is the farthest north part of the ward used to belong to Otagi County, Kyoto Prefecture although it is geographically more akin to Shiga Prefecture in the east.

sen.j: 当区は昭和4年（1929年）、当時の上京区から分区して成立したものである。
sen.e: Separated from the then Kamigyo Ward, Sakyo Ward was established in 1929.
Separated from the then Kamigyo Ward, Sakyo Ward was established in 1929.

sen.j: 成立当時の区域は下鴨各町、北白川各町を含んでそれより南の地区のみであった。
sen.e: Around that time the ward area was south of the neighborhoods of Shimogamo and Kitashirakawa which it also included.

sen.j: 昭和5年（1930年）に東山区との区境変更があり、区南端の粟田口地区の一部が東山区に編入された。
sen.e: In 1930 when its border with Higashiyama Ward was changed, the Awataguchi area along the southern edge was partly incorporated into Higashiyama Ward.
In 1930 when its border with Higashiyama Ward was changed, the Awataguchi area along the southern edge was partly incorporated into Higashiyama Ward.

sen.j: 昭和6年に愛宕郡修学院村と松ケ崎村、昭和24年（1949年）に同郡岩倉村、八瀬村、大原村、静市野村、鞍馬村、花脊村、久多村を編入した。
sen.e: The ward incorporated the Villages of Shugakuin and Matsugasaki, Atago County in 1931, and in 1949 it included the Villages of Iwakura, Yase, Ohara, Shizuichino, Kurama, Hanase, and Kuta in the same county.

The ward incorporated the villages of Shugakuin and Matsugasaki, Atago County in 1931, and in 1949 it included the villages of Iwakura, Yase, Ohara, Shizuichino, Kurama, Hanase, and Kuta in the same county.

sen.j: 昭和32年（1957年）には北桑田郡京北町の一部（大字広河原）を編入し、現在の区域となった。
sen.e: It integrated part of Keihoku-cho, Kitakuwada County (Oaza Hirogawara) in 1957, resulting in the present area of the ward.

Summary of town names

tit.e: Summary of town names

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: Like 'Ohara Raikoin-cho, Sakyo Ward,' some town names in Kyoto City indicate broad regions ('Ohara' in the case just cited) derived from the names of the former villages or 'Oaza' (administrative units below a town).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'

sen.j: 左京区内の町名は区の南西端の二条川東地区にある29町と、永観堂町、永観堂西町、銀閣寺町、銀閣寺前町、黒谷町、若王子町が単独町名である。
sen.e: The following towns in the ward have independent town names: 29 towns in the Nijokawa-higashi area along the south-western border, Eikando-cho, Eikando-nishi-machi, Ginkakuji-cho, Ginkakujimae-cho, Kurodani-cho and Nyakuoji-cho.

sen.j: 他は旧大字名などの地区名を冠した複合町名である。

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば1980年現在569町であった。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa's Geographical Dictionary of Japan 26: Kyoto Prefecture" the ward had 569 official town names in 1980.

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 569 declared towns as of 1980.

sen.j: 区内には「修学院音羽谷」「松ケ崎東山」のように、末尾に「町」字を付さない町名が一部に存在する。
sen.e: Some town names in the ward have no designation of '町'(town) as for example in 'Shugakuin Otowadani' or 'Matsugasaki Higashiyama.'

sen.j: これらは、いずれも昭和6年（1931年）に編入された地区であり、山間部などで、昭和6年の町名成立時において当該区域内に人家が存在しなかったものである。
sen.e: Each of these towns was incorporated into the ward in 1931 at which time there was no house in the areas which were mostly moutainous.
The reason is that when they were incorporated into the ward and given names in 1931, there were no houses in these towns since they were located in the mountainous regions.

sen.j: 区の南西端、鴨川の東、二条通りの南北の地区の町名は、広域地名を冠称しない単独町名となっている。

sen.j: 宝永5年（1708年）の洛中の大火後、焼け出された住民が移転してきて新たな町をつくったものが多い。

sen.e: (Towns established in 1965, of the former Oaza Shirakawa) Kasaneishi-cho, Kogamedani-cho, Mukogadani-cho, Mukaidani-cho, Maruyama-cho, Kiyozawaguchi-cho, Jizodani-cho, Minamigahara-cho, Nakayama-cho, Yomogigadani-cho, Iwasaka-cho, Toyama-cho, Uryuzan-cho.

sen.e: (Established in 1965, of the former Oaza Kitashirakawa) Kasaneishi-cho, Kogamedani-cho, Mukogadani-cho, Mukaidani-cho, Maruyama-cho, Kiyozawaguchi-cho, Jizodani-cho, Minamigahara-cho, Nakayama-cho, Yomogigadani-cho, Iwasaka-cho, Toyama-cho, Uryuzan-cho

sen.j: 旧下鴨村、上賀茂村
sen.e: Former Villages of Shimogamo and Kamigamo
Former villages of Shimogamo and Kamigamo
sen.cmt: village を小文字にしました。
sen.e: Former villages of Shimogamo and Kamigamo

sen.j: 「下鴨」を冠称する町名は、もとの愛宕郡下鴨村で、大正7年（1918年）、当時の上京区に編入された。
sen.e: Towns broadly designated 'Shimogamo' belonged to Shimogamo Village, Otagi County which was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918.
Towns prefixed by 'Shimogamo' originally belonged to Shimogamo village, Otagi County which was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918.
sen.cmt: 既出表現と統一しました。
sen.e: Towns prefixed by 'Shimogamo' originally belonged to Shimogamo village, Otagi County which was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918.

sen.j: 下鴨村には大字はなく、旧村域は大正7年、「下鴨」を冠称する17町に編成された。
sen.e: Shimogamo Village which had no area called Oaza was divided into 17 towns broadly designated 'Shimogamo' in 1918.
Shimogamo Village which had no Oaza was divided into 17 towns prefixed by 'Shimogamo' in 1918.
sen.cmt: broadly designated → prefixd by に変更しました。
sen.e: Shimogamo Village which had no Oaza was divided into 17 towns prefixed by 'Shimogamo' in 1918.

sen.j: その後、以下のような町名町界の変更を経て、「下鴨」を冠称する町は46町となっている。
sen.e: The following denominational and demarcational changes were subsequently made to the towns with the regional designation 'Shimogamo,' which currently amounts to 46.
The following denominational and demarcational changes were subsequently made to the towns with the prefix of 'Shimogamo,' which currently amounts to 46.
sen.cmt: with the regional designation→with the prefix としました。
sen.e: The following denominational and demarcational changes were subsequently made to the towns with the prefix of 'Shimogamo,' which currently amounts to 46.

sen.j: （昭和13年成立）塚本町、東塚本町、岸本町、東岸本町、梅ノ木町、東・西梅ノ木町、本町、東・西本町、東森ケ前町、東・西高木町
sen.e: (Towns established in 1938) Tsukamoto-cho, Higashi-tsukamoto-cho, Kishimoto-cho, Higashi-kishimoto-cho, Umenoki-cho, Higashi-umenoki-cho, Nishi-umenoki-cho, Hon-machi, Higashi-hon-machi, Nishi-hon-machi, Higashi-morigamae-cho, Higashi-takagi-cho, Nishi-takagi-cho.

(Established in 1938) Tsukamoto-cho, Higashi Tsukamoto-cho, Kishimoto-cho, Higashi Kishimoto-cho, Umenoki-cho, Higashi Umenoki-cho, Nishi Umenoki-cho, Hon-machi, Higashi Hon-machi, Nishi Hon-machi, Higashi Morigamae-cho, Higashi Takagi-cho, Nishi Takagi-cho
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。地名表現を変更しました。ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: (Established in 1938) Tsukamoto-cho, Higashi Tsukamoto-cho, Kishimoto-cho, Higashi Kishimoto-cho, Umenoki-cho, Higashi Umenoki-cho, Nishi Umenoki-cho, Hon-machi, Higashi Hon-machi, Nishi Hon-machi, Higashi Morigamae-cho, Higashi Takagi-cho, Nishi Takagi-cho

sen.j: （昭和14年成立）東・西半木町、貴船町
sen.e: (Towns established in 1939) Higashi-hangi-cho, Nishi-hangi-cho, Kibune-cho.
(Established in 1939) Higashi Hangi-cho, Nishi Hangi-cho, Kibune-cho
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。地名表現を変更しました。ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: (Established in 1939) Higashi Hangi-cho, Nishi Hangi-cho, Kibune-cho

sen.j: （昭和24年上京区上賀茂より編入）北・南茶ノ木町*、水口町*、北・南芝町*、北・南野々神町、梁田町、夜光町、神殿町、狗子田町、前萩町、萩ケ垣内町
sen.e: (Towns transferred from Kamigamo, Kamigyo Ward in 1949) Kita-chanoki-cho*, Minami-chanoki-cho*, Minakuchi-cho*, Kita-shiba-cho*, Minami-shiba-cho*, Kita-nonogami-cho, Minami-nonogami-cho, Yanada-cho, Yako-cho, Kodono-cho, Inokoda-cho, Maehagi-cho, Hagigakakiuchi-cho.

sen.e: (Transferred from Kamigamo, Kamigyo Ward in 1949) Kita Chanoki-cho*, Minami Chanoki-cho*, Minakuchi-cho*, Kita Shiba-cho*, Minami Shiba-cho*, Kita Nonogami-cho, Minami Nonogami-cho, Yanada-cho, Yako-cho, Kodono-cho, Inokoda-cho, Maehagi-cho, Hagigakakiuchi-cho
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。地名表現を変更しました。ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: (Transferred from Kamigamo, Kamigyo Ward in 1949) Kita Chanoki-cho*, Minami Chanoki-cho*, Minakuchi-cho*, Kita Shiba-cho*, Minami Shiba-cho*, Kita Nonogami-cho, Minami Nonogami-cho, Yanada-cho, Yako-cho, Kodono-cho, Inokoda-cho, Maehagi-cho, Hagigakakiuchi-cho

sen.j: （以上、*印は昭和15年成立、他は昭和6年成立）
sen.e: (Those marked with * were established in 1940; the rest were created in 1931).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Those marked with * were established in 1940; the rest were created in 1931).
(Those marked with * were established in 1940; the rest were created in 1931).

sen.j: 「賀茂」を冠称する2町はもとの愛宕郡上賀茂村である。
sen.e: Two towns broadly designated 'Kamo' belonged to the former Kamigamo Village, Otagi County.
The two towns prefixed by 'Kamo' originally belonged to the former Kamigamo village, Otagi County.
sen.cmt: broadly designated → prefixd by に変更しました。
sen.e: The two towns prefixed by 'Kamo' originally belonged to the former Kamigamo village, Otagi County.

sen.j: 上賀茂村には上賀茂、小山の2つの大字があった。
sen.e: Kamigamo Village had two areas called Oaza, namely Oaza Kamigamo and Oaza Koyama.
Kamigamo village had two Oaza, namely Oaza Kamigamo and Oaza Koyama.
sen.cmt: village を小文字にしました。
sen.e: Kamigamo village had two Oaza, namely Oaza Kamigamo and Oaza Koyama.

sen.j: このうち大字小山は大正7年（1918年）、当時の上京区に編入され、現在は北区のうちとなっている。
sen.e: Oaza Oyama was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and is now part of Kita Ward.
Oaza Oyama was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and is now part of Kita Ward.
Oaza Oyama was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918 and is now part of Kita Ward.

sen.j: 大字上賀茂は一部が大正7年、当時の上京区に編入された。
sen.e: Oaza Kamigamo was partly incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Oaza Kamigamo was partly incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918.
Oaza Kamigamo was partly incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1918.

sen.j: 「賀茂」を冠称する4町（今井町、半木町、板倉町、玄以町）に編成された。
sen.e: It was then divided into four towns broadly designated 'Kamo' (Kamo Imai-cho, Kamo Hangi-cho, Kamo Itakura-cho and Kamo Geni-cho).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was then reorganized into four towns prefixed by 'Kamo' (Kamo Imai-cho, Kamo Hangi-cho, Kamo Itakura-cho and Kamo Geni-cho).
sen.cmt: broadly designated → prefixd by に変更しました。
sen.e: It was then reorganized into four towns prefixed by 'Kamo' (Kamo Imai-cho, Kamo Hangi-cho, Kamo Itakura-cho and Kamo Geni-cho).

sen.j: このうち、板倉町は昭和11年、玄以町は昭和12年に廃止された。
sen.e: Of these Itakura-cho was abolished in 1936 and Geni-cho in 1937.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Of these Itakura-cho was abolished in 1936 and Geni-cho in 1937.
Of these Itakura-cho was abolished in 1936 and Geni-cho in 1937.

sen.j: だが、「板倉」、「玄以」の地名は、現在の北区小山の町名に継承されている。
sen.e: These place names of 'Itakura' and 'Geni' still remain as town names in Oyama, Kita Ward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These place names of 'Itakura' and 'Geni' still remain as town names in Koyama, Kita Ward.
These place names of 'Itakura' and 'Geni' still remain as town names in Koyama, Kita Ward.

sen.j: 以上により、「賀茂」を冠称する町名は2町となっている。
sen.e: Thus, there are two towns broadly designated 'Kamo.'
Thus, there are two towns prefixed by 'Kamo.'
sen.cmt: broadly designated → prefixd by に変更しました。
sen.e: Thus, there are two towns prefixed by 'Kamo.'

sen.j: なお、大字上賀茂の残余は、昭和6年、当時の上京区に編入された。
sen.e: The rest of Oaza Kamigamo was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1931.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The rest of Oaza Kamigamo was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1931.
The rest of Oaza Kamigamo was incorporated into the then Kamigyo Ward in 1931.

sen.j: 「上賀茂」を冠称する町名となり、現在は北区に属している。
sen.e: It has been divided into towns broadly designated 'Kamigamo,' which now all belong to Kita Ward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has been divided into towns prefixed by 'Kamigamo,' which now all belong to Kita Ward.
sen.cmt: broadly designated → prefixd by に変更しました。
